DOC.brief_summary: Coenzyme Q10 ( Ubiquinone ) recognize endogenous fat-soluble antioxidant mitochondrial membrane consider preventive factor coronary artery disease ( CAD ) . However , relationship coenzyme Q10 prevention risk CAD still inconsistent . The purpose study investigate relation coenzyme Q10 concentration blood lipid level , plasma homocysteine , marker lipid peroxidation ( TBARS , ox-LDL ) , antioxidant enzyme activity ( catalase , glutathione peroxidase , superoxide dismutase ) examine association risk CAD.The CAD patient identify cardiac catheterization least 50 % stenosis one major coronary artery ( n = 100 ) . The second year double-blind , placebo-controlled intervention study . CAD subject ( n = 60 ) randomly assign one three group ( coenzyme Q10 supplement 60 mg/d , 150 mg/d , placebo group , n = 20/group ) . Intervention go administration three month . The third year case-control study . The control group （n = 100） comprise healthy individual normal blood biochemical value , match age gender first year CAD subject ( case group ) . Fasting blood sample obtain determine concentration coenzyme Q10 , homocysteine , marker lipid peroxidation , antioxidant enzyme activity . The difference case control group compare use Student 's t-test . Conditional logistical regression model perform calculate odds ratio CAD base coenzyme Q10 level . Hopefully , result study could provide information know CAD subject . We expect coenzyme Q10 could preventive supplement reduce risk CAD .
